Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: EAVP212
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended the Best Western on Rue. Saint Honore and we could not have been happier. The location is superb. You are around the corner from the Louvre-Rivoli stop on the 1 line and three blocks from the Louvre and Palais Royal subway stop. The rooms were quite comfortable, roomy, and very clean. There are many different options for room sizes so when you make your reservation, call or research the choices. If you want a large room that is typical of most American style rooms, they have them but they will cost more which is typical of Europe. The standard room was perfect and appropriate for what we were looking for. The bathroom was much larger than most European bathrooms which was a plus. You have free wi-fi; only person can use the account at a time but the fact that internet is free, I think the limits are not a deal breaker. The staff is wonderful and attentive! All were so professional and helpful. They made our stay lovely. For travelers who like to spend most of the time outside of the hotel, walk the city and take public transportation, this is a perfect place. If you are looking for a hotel with several restaurants, a lively bar, and more amenities, this may not be the best option. Within 100 feet of the hotel are two local boulangeries that have great pastries and coffee for less than 3 euro. North of the hotel are some local places within 5 clocks--Rue de Montregeuil has a great market and you can shop at the local chocolatiers, wine shops, and bakeries. Streets like Rue Montmartre offer travelers the chance to roam through non-touristy neighborhoods. The cookware shops like Dehellerin, G. Detou, and A. Simon are also close by. Within a 15 minute walk, you can get to the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, L'Orangerie, and Jardin de Tuileries. In terms of restaurants, you have three great sandwich shops, Cafe Ruc, Cafe Bis, Cafe Saint Honore, and Le Petit Machon; all present local Parisian menus but cater to tourists. I would stay at the Best Western again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfort and Cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: eibhlin c C
Reviews.Content: Excellent location adjoining the Louvre. We stayed in a deluxe room for a very reasonable price in an excellent part of Paris .We enjoyed an extremely comfortable bed,a spacious spotless bathroom and a quiet well heated room.The staff gave us a very good restaurant recommendation,,"le Chien qui fume", printed out our boarding passes and booked the minibus return to the airport. Complimentary tea or coffee was available in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: Parisforwork
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1.30pm to find the hotel locked, so we had to go away and return half an hour later to get in. Not a good or welcoming first impression. It would have been nice if we could wait in the lobby at least ... But no. The wifi allows access for on 1 computer at a time, making it difficult for 2 people to get work done at the same time, even though we clearly booked a room for 2 people. The font desk had absolutely no flexibility on this matter which we found quite hard to believe. Definitely not 4star service! Sunday morning at about 8.30, we were woken up by the maid opening the door to our room. We had not placed the do not disturb card on the door admittedly, but still thought 8.30 was too early for sunday! Coffee at breakfast sated like instant coffee, not filtered! The room and bathroom were otherwise clean and small, but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth of the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very small room (just bed). Doorman not very friendly. Breakfest otherwise OK but there was not enough products (quantitywise) available. I had every morning to ask more juice or sausages or bread because there were not any available

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Eymery
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel in the centre of Paris. The room was absolutely lovely.. very spacious with a massive bathroom and walk in shower. Staff very helpful. Breakfast was rather basic... not much choice but loads of restaurants in the vicinity for anyone looking for something more substantial. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Guidelines”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location in center of the city and near to mains museums and attractions. Lovely room's furniture but my room is real too small. Clean and nice bathroom. Polite and approchable personnel department.

Reviews.Title: “let's call it....a small cosy nest”
Reviews.Author: Alek77
Reviews.Content: When one goes to Paris he already knows it’s hard to get a good hotel, centrally located, at a reasonable price. If you don’t mind sleeping in a tiny room, that has anyway everything you need, this is possibly one good choice combining the most convenient location and reasonable pricing. Hotel has been probably made out of a very old building, nestled between two others, and from the narrow façade you can already imagine the size the room will have. When you step inside all common areas are modernly furnished and décor is morbid and cosy. We visited during a very cold winter so when you step back in it’s always nice to enjoy a hot tea in front of a warm fireplace (a gas-powered one). Pros: - Location, location, location. If you Land in Charles de Gaulle airport you take the RER B to Chatelet, then switch and take metro number 1, and hotel is just one stop away and 30 seconds from the subway station. Furthermore it is not facing the trafficked Rue de Rivoli but the quiet Rue St. Honoré. My room was facing an inner courtyard, meaning I had a good silent undisturbed sleep at night. As the name states, the hotel is just opposite the Louvre Museum and 10 minutes from Notre Dame. You also get a pretty good choice of restaurants nearby which are not too expensive and cater also for locals and not just tourists. I will recommend a couple: Pizza Oskian has good pizza (and I’m Italian I can tell!) and is reasonably priced offering full meals from 15 to 19 euros including dessert. In the evening I recommend the tiny “Le Petit Machon”. Specialties from Lyon and lovely atmosphere. - Hotel is clean, staff is helpful, room was Ok and had all amenities. Internet is WIFI-FI and offered free of charge throughout your stay. Hotel is silent which means you can rest and sleep well. I was sleeping on the 4th floor and there was only one other room except mine. Cons: - Classic room is very tiny. Even though it is very nicely furnished and décor is also original two people will need to move one at a time or you will bump against each other! Being alone I had nothing to complain. It’s true they have bigger deluxe rooms, 10 square meters more spacious, but you must be willing to pay much more to get one. Bathroom was also small but clean and you get only a shower, not a bathtub (which was fine with me). You get Lanvin amenities in the bathroom. - No complimentary tea and coffee and no complimentary bottle of water. - When we arrived at the hotel the man at the reception was on lunch break. I find it really extravagant that a hotel chain like Best Western cannot provide a replacement. We were ushered in by a maid and were left alone waiting for like 20 minutes. Then we decided to go have a lunch and left there our luggage and went back to check in after lunch. Being a 4 star hotel management should at least have two people at the reception alternating each other. Besides this my overall experience was more than positive. At the time of my booking my room was 175 euros. Good value for money considering service and location. Get a look at my pictures to get a real glimpse of it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel location was in a prime area. A walking distance from the Louvre, and the Notre-dam Cathedral. The hotel personnel were very helpful and friendly. They were very receptive to requests. The room are cozy and very clean. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: esk0 Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: perfect stay in a very well situated area with very good breakfast & very helpful staff. Only the cleaning at the room was lower compared to the hotel quality & to my expectations.We had out off shampoo & soap for 3 days....maybe beacuse of the first day of the year but you should take your precautions before the special days....there can be a small (something) for the guest who spend their new year eve at your hotel.I've expected that...your in Paris & new year eve !!! Nothing from your hotel not even a note on your bed...

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: uwe80637 Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location - BUT: rooms (and the lift) are very small; the choice of TV-channels is very limited (the only german TV-station available is RTL !); the staff (with the exception of the reception) definitely lacks training (or is underpaid) - no smiles, no greetings, no service mentality, guests at the beakfast-room get the impression to be unwelcome; compared with other Best Western Premier Hotels (in Germany for ex.) the breakfast is minimalistic and not of a good standard: scrambled eggs were hard, the selection of cheese was limited to two kinds (in France !), the water in the Evian bottle came from the tap etc.

Reviews.Title: “great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaWedd11
Reviews.Content: It was a good price, more than ample accommodations. Great location, walking distance to the Louvre, friendly staff. We had a great time. The only reason this doesn't get 5 stars is because it does not have the luxury of a five star hotel but that is to be expected. worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellet location, high prices.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent location, deluxe room nice and clean but very modest, usual price 600 euros per night, we took an offer for 225euros. The best thing about the hotel is how close it is to everywhere. Underground station 2 minutes walk. Breakfast expensive but it is expensive anyway in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Oksana938
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Paris. Perfect location. The hotel is located just near the Louvre museum and close to the opera, its very clean and comfortable with staff really helpful.I found the receptionists very charming, speaking also slavic languages. We had a courtyard view and the breakfast is OK, but not for 19 euro and this is probably the only thing that has bothered me.

Reviews.Title: “confortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Muy agradable por su situación, céntrico pero en sitio tranquilo, estupendamente rodeado de sitios para comer, comprar, pasear, metro próximo etc. Al ser pequeño no tienes la típica sensación de estar en un hotel, apenas te cruzas con nadie, salvo el recepcionista siempre pendiente de tí, parece que simplemente estás en una casa con una habitación estupenda.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for location, comfort & cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, could walk to everywhere we wanted to go and the room is exactly as pictured on the website. The bathroom was spacious and spotless. The bed was exactly what we needed after the long flight from Australia. Can't comment on the breakfast because we didn't eat there, so many other places to choose from. View from the window wasn't ideal but just walk out the front, turn a corner and see the Louvre. Concierge was super efficient and polite. Was only travelling with my daughter so not sure what the other rooms would be like for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorDan5 Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by this gem of a hotel just around the corner from the Louvre. We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel room was large by European standards and the decorations were very calming.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not Enough”
Reviews.Author: Fotodaze Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this small "hotel" in terms of off the street rooms (my wife and I paid for a deluxe) which was quiet, of reasonable size, and well cleaned each day. The problem was paying $300 a night for a small place with no services to speak of, banking on its location to overcharge. This has become a big problem in Paris generally. These small hotels are edging closer to what one might pay to stay in a chain or full service hotel without providing any of the advantages...no concierge, no bellman to carry your bags up, a squeeze in size elevator, and a breakfast that cost what we Americans pay for a good dinner at home, $27 (without wine.) I have visited Paris over 50 times. I love the city, but it is more of an economic challenge each time, and I find it difficult to be loyal to any hotel. We did spend years staying at the Holiday Inn Republique, but it has morphed into the Crown Royal and doesn't look the same. It had become expensive, but at least you had services and very large rooms for the money. I think all these Paris hotels rely on naive travelers to keep themselves full, but that may change with the sinking economy.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bingfa
Reviews.Content: Great location, small and very quiet hotel with great staff and close (VERY close) to Louvre. We enjoyed an extended week-end at the hotel and the local restaurants are great. I gave excellent rating for the pool....No there are no pool but the bathroom was great :-)

Reviews.Title: “HAD A GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Nov. 5 to Nov. 9, 2011. Very strategic location , walking distance to the Louvre, and nice restaurants. Impressive rooms due to its cleanliness ang big bathroom with nice rain shower heads. Pillows are feather soft and nice bed. Always maintained clean everytime we return to the hotel, room is made up like there's not a single trace that we messed up the bed before we left. Staff very accomodating, very helpful and friendly. Receptionist male even lent me some Euros when we arrived having US Dollars , haven't gone to the Changer yet. Safe / vault was repaired immediately when we requested. Lady receptionist very polite and gracious. Front desk receptionist, Vincent helped us check in the airline the night before our flight, was very hospitable. I didn't try the restaurant in the hotel because there were so many nice restaurants nearby which opens early and costs less. Overall I would rate this hotel as VERY SATISFATORY. I'm glad I cancelled my booking in the 5 Star hotel which is nearer the Louvre due to some miscommunication, otherwise, I wouldn't have discovered this Hotel. Price is reasonable considering its good location. Slept well because bed is so comfy, I can't believe I got up late on the day of my flight cuz I overslept, good quality sleep in this hotel. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Tracey W
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe room with breakfast included. The room was beautiful and a nice size especially by European standards. The cloth wallpaper wasn't the most hygenic choice though and I did notice areas where it appeared wine or soda had sprayed up and an attempt to clean it was not successful. The elevator is small as many have mentioned but it did the job for one person and their luggage at a time. The bathroom was massive and quite lovely although the overhead shower didn't seem to work in our room, there was a hand held one that worked fine. The front desk staff was very pleasant except for one older gentleman that ignored almost every "bonjour" we gave him, we finally grew tired of it and just quit greeting him. The person that greeted us was Clement I believe and he was a charming young man and a great asset for the hotel. The breakfast was good but at 19 euros each we would have sampled the cafes nearby if it were not included in our package. The location is fantastic for sightseeing most of the areas you'll want to see. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family so therefore am recommending it to you.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very well located, very comfortable, quiet and more important, managed by very, very nice people. It is very convenient for business and leisure travelling.I like the little salon with the chimney that in winter days is highly appreciated. it is my choice when travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel prior to it becoming a Best Western Premier and have to say improvements are great. Very friendly staff and rooms have been updated very well, whilst retaining the small hotel feel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: McT853
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in October and was a really nice stay. The rooms were a nice size and very clean and was perfect for what we needed. We didn't try the breakfast but plenty of places near by if needed. Lots of information was given at reception and they were very helpful and polite, especially when we checked out as the member of staff helped us with travel up to Monmartre and routes to look around when we got there which was brill. The best part was location, walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame and the Pompidou as well as metros, bus stops, cafes and a small supermarket. Also a very nice restaurant next door should be tried. The only negative we could think of was that the hotel itself is quite small, small lift and small corridors but we didn't have a lot of luggage so wasn't a problem but could be a problem for people who do. Overall a brilliant stay in Paris would recommend and definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Ann444
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location. Being close to everything, including public transportation made it easier for us to fit in all the sites in a short period of time. Plus with it being so close to the Louvre, it was easy to head back for a quick rest before heading back out again! Staff at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed our stay at BW Louvre Saint Honore!

Reviews.Title: “Paris ~ a short stroll away”
Reviews.Author: trvlfun
Reviews.Content: I have been in love with Paris for as long as I can remember and because my visit was just for a few days, I wanted to be centrally located. This hotel is amazingly located - everything is at your fingertips. It is a bit pricey, but it turns out that it was fashion week and rooms were dear. If the cost was a little less, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Louvre”
Reviews.Author: MGastwirth
Reviews.Content: We booked this Best Western near the Louvre at about half the price of the Marriott very near by where we stayed earlier in the trip. The rooms were about the same size and the Best Western was clean and neat. I would definitely recommend this hotel for it's central location and adequate accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelMagazineDotOrg
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great location, very close to Louvre. Room is comfortable, staff is friendly, though one restaurant advise was a definite tourist trap. Don't take hotel's breakfast, expensive and unnecessary - there are better places around.

Reviews.Title: “ok but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed there in 7 rooms but paid a very expensive price , probably due to the fact that there were many fairs at that time in paris. but except that hotel is in best location , staff is friendly and helpful , rooms are clean and breakfast is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Charming reasonably priced boutique hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DonMacP
Reviews.Content: Stayed several days this summer at this Best Western. First recommendation is its excellent central location..easy walk along Rue Rivoli for shopping and to the Marais and a couple of blocks to the Louvre and going westerly to the top line shops..worth just seeing! Easy walk to the Left Bank (15 minutes). Secondly, the very accommodating and pleasant staff...the receptionist, a young Canadian male, seeing all our luggage, immediately gave us an upgraded room on the main floor with access to a little courtyard. (and despite asking later for a coffee having missed breakfast, he went and made an expresso downstairs and brought it to the room at no charge). Third..the most comfortable bed out of 5 hotels (all 4 star) we tried in Europe on this trip, and fourth, while not a large room, it was very nicely decorated and comfortable AND extremely quiet..with that heavenly bed it was far too easy to sleep in to 11am!! excellent value for the room cost.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and helpful staff. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Joe K
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel. Even though we arrived before noon local time the room was ready for us. After a long flight this was very nice. The room itself was clean quiet and comfortable. The staff, especially the woman at the front desk, was very helpful. This was our first time in Paris and she gladly answered questions, provided us with local maps, and made helpful suggestions. Mostly she made us feel welcome and comfortable. Another hotel plus, the location. We were able to walk to many of the places we wanted to see. we were just blocks from the Louvre and the Seine. Upon staffs suggestion we started our first full day in Paris with a river cruise. The narration was informative, gave us a feel for where things were, and helped us plan our activities from there. All in all, if this is your first time in Paris, this is a very good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: chevyguyz
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel in Paris very near the Louvre. We were also very lucky to find it only a few blocks from a Mormon or LDS church. The rooms were a nice size, the staff was helpful, the location was great, and the neighborhood was quiet. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel but definitely over priced with no service”
Reviews.Author: fab68
Reviews.Content: very well located but very expensive for a 4 stars hotel. With a rack rate of 600 euros per night you can expect a minimum service . We had to bring our luggage up and down by ourselves and the internet broke down for half day. The amenities dodn't get refilled and the fresh towels were dirty. The night staff was nice although the day staff was very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, we will go back”
Reviews.Author: EricaFrance
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. On arrival, very pleasant surprise to find that we had been upgraded to a suite on the top floor, which would happily have accommodated a family of 4. The hotel was clean and modern, with an art deco style. Staff were helpful and friendly, (special mention to the breakfast assistants for finding us some marmelade and always giving a cheerful start to the day!). Other people have commented on the pint-sized lift; yes, it is small but it does the job! Location just minutes from the Louvre; easy walking distance to the Opera Garnier. No restaurant on site but the Italian next door does great pizza when you're too tired to go out again after a day's sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Sight Seeing Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we needed. It is within a few hundred yards of the Louvre with access to the Tuileries and the fair with the Paris wheel. There is a 24 hour concierge with helpful advice, lovely ladies serving at breakfast and the housekeeping was faultless. Luckily we did not intend to loiter in our room as the only downside was the TV did not function at all for three out of our four nights. The Metro access was just down the road, there were Velib stands round nearly every corner and restaurants which provided excellent food all around.

Reviews.Title: “Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent venue, wonderfully helpful staff, the room much larger than expected for Paris. Great location only a block away from the Louvre and walking distance to much much more. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very good overall”
Reviews.Author: Forevertraveller81
Reviews.Content: Great location and nice rooms. I have been actualy upgrated to a very nice junior suite for free and this is obviously a plus. I also tried the breakfast but, as usual in Paris, was not that great and with a good variety. The staff was very nice and helpful, no complaints at all. I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you manage to find decent fares online.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice stay in this hotel that has a fantatic location if you want to visit The Louvres. Easy to stard walking through Paris, safe area, close to tube station and to most of the theatres. People working in this hotel are friendly and ready to help you improving your stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very good place : quiet and very well located”
Reviews.Author: Muxu
Reviews.Content: Very central, close to metro and RER, lot of nice restaurants Staff very nice I had the chance to be upgrade ... but they could because due to fashion fair the price was quite expensive Very clean ...quiet .... safe Do not hesitate to go

Reviews.Title: “An excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of everything for the first-time traveller to Paris. Staff was friendly and seemed genuinely interested in your needs. Rooms spacious (for France) and well appointed. Beds comfortable. Several excellent "authentic" French eateries up and down the street. Skip the pricey breakfast and go down the street for half the price. Best Western rarely disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “First time family trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Teacherdeb1 Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel through online resources and researched lots of information about location, comfort, etc. This small but comfortable hotel exceeded our expectations. It has a great location for access to many of the traditional Paris sights and shopping. Close to a Metro station and great walking distance. The staff is very helpful, the breakfast is very good (great service too), rooms are very clean, beds are comfortable. We were more than satisfied and it made for a great trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Possibly the best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located very strategically. We walked pretty much to most of the sight-seeing places. We had to take the bus for Sacre C'ouer only. And that too a straight bus without changing. Some of the places we walked are about 30 minutes but that's the best way to see Paris anyway. Hotel was neat and clean. Had minor issue with hot water one evening. The front desk staff was very helpful and tried as much to fix it. Lots of restaurants nearby as well. The hotel is bit expensive but for the location who will charge less?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: glorygirl14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a great place to stay. First, the hotel was clean, air conditioned and very comfortable to come to after a long day on your feet trying to see all the sites Paris has to offer. The staff were so helpful, they recommended places to see, where to eat, and how to get along on the metro if you needed it. Pierrre Lartigue, the manger of the hotel helped my family with extra reservations that needed to be made outside of our stay at the hotel. He gave us comfort and was such a big help when we needed it especially when you do not read or write in their language. The location was amazing, we were within walking distance to the Louvre, the Museum de Orsay, and much more. The metro was just about two blocks away, and the restaurants within walking distance were very good with much variety. I could go and on and on, in a nut shell, the room was clean and comfortable, and the staff were helpful and courteous,and the location was super. I would recommend this place to stay in Paris. When we return to Paris, we will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight layover in Paris after a trip to Italy. Chose this hotel for its great location and ability to do some quick sightseeing as it is right across the street from the Louvre. I was not disappointed. Best night of sleep I had during my entire vacation. I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Comments”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a ten nights stay as tourists and we can say that the location of the hotel and the cleanliness of the room were excelent, the general attention and quality of the room are very good and the price is justified in Paris. We consider it a good option for tourists or business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Chic hotel. Wonderful staff. Definately stay again.”
Reviews.Author: sharyn054
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying here for 8 days. This was the start of our first overseas trip. I really wanted the experience of staying in a boutique hotel. We were not disappointed. The room although small was extremely comfortable and clean, and the decor very attractive. It was convenient having free internet access in the room. I cannot remember ever sleeping as well as I did during those eight days. The staff did everything in their power to ensure that our stay was enjoyable. The hotel is located within a comfortable walking distance of major tourist attactions such as the Louvre, Notre Dame and the Musee D Orsay. There are an abundance of cafes and restaurants located within easy walking distance that provide quality food and service at affordable prices. We had the most amazing time. Paris is such a beautiful city and I believe that staying at this fabulous little hotel certainly enhanced our experience. We would not hesitate to return or recommend. Thank you so much for making of stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: seapointlodge
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for pottering about in central Paris - both sides of the Seine. The reception staff were welcoming, helpful and engaging. Our accommodation ( was small as we expected) but otherwise excellent. Friendly cafes and bars down the street and all the sights within walking distance. We had a great time. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyR55
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend staying at this lovely little hotel. The location is great. The Louvre, Notre-Dame and Musee d'Orsay are all within walking distance. There is a subway stop just a block away. The hotel was modern and very clean. Our room was small but not tiny and the bathroom was new with a real shower. .

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room's chairs were made for children. Very tiny and made of plastic. An adult simply cannot sit on chairs that size! Hardly value for money at this price as one cannot even sit in peace at a desk in the room and do office work . They promise a Tea/Coffe maker in the room at the booking site but there was none; this was made available but I had to ask for it. The tea/coffe/sugar was not replaced at the tray by room service, neither was bathroom amenities such as shoe-shine sponge.

Reviews.Title: “jardinsjardins”
Reviews.Author: GaetanoRoma Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: lounge is too small, not of a 4 stars hotel, the staff at the hall (concierge) is only one at time and 3 times we and other guests find the street door closed. For less money we had a better hotel in this area, like Royal St Honorè, who is more close to the center of the town, Place Vendome, Concorde.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mervalino
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just a couple of days and chose the hotel as we have stayed in Best Westerns before and feel we can trust them. Also the location was perfect for tourists. There was no view, but we spent much of our time wandering around the area and window shopping. The hotel is much funkier than other Best Westerns, quite chic! The staff were very helpful, even when we had to change our room due to a maintenance requirement, as we were given a free breakfast. I wouldn't recommend breakfast at the hotel as there are so many better patisseries nearby to choose from. We really like the organic Pain Quotidienne just round the corner. Our room was quiet and comfortable, and I really like the Lanvin products in the bathroom and the free Wi-Fi. We also liked the option of normal walk-in shower with a rain shower. Overall I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel with a "boutique hotel" feel”
Reviews.Author: saadb
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very helpful staff. Modern and very well kept. Excellent value for cost.

Reviews.Title: “The friendly people made this a holiday to remember”
Reviews.Author: kmryan
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location. But more importantly the personnel here are friendly and helpful. They directed us to places to visit, eat and see. Overall a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: linwal
Reviews.Content: We would like to sincerely thank you for your assistance during our stay at your hotel from Nov 7-Nov 10. We found your hotel to be very nice and clean. The location was excellant. Reception was so helpful with our questions regarding directions and making shuttle arrangements for us to the airport. Again, thank you! We will certainly recommend your facility to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the centre of Paris...”
Reviews.Author: Spottelurcher
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this lovely hotel with my daughter to celebrate her 18th birthday. My husband choose this hotel for us as it was extremely central and close (2 minutes) to the Louvre that my daughter wished to visit for her A Level programme. From the second we entered the hotel we were warmly welcomed by the most charming, and extremely professional and courteous staff. The hotel might be small but this is part of it's magic and attraction. It is immaculately clean!!! (and believe me I'm fussy!), the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in (they have gorgeous mattress "toppers"). Within the immediate area there are fantastic restaurants of all price ranges (le chein qui fume being one). So what the lift is small, who cares, this is a really lovely hotel, that could not be more centrally located, and the staff at this hotel should be appalled for their charm and helpfulness - many of the 5-star hotels I have stayed with in the past and I'm not joking here) should take a lesson from the front of house staff and housekeeping at this hotel. I will, without doubt, be returning to Paris and staying at this hotel again and cannot recommend it enough. Well done and thank you to all the staff at Best Western Premier Louvre Saint Honore for an enjoyable and memorable stay. Best wishes, Isabella and Helana.

Reviews.Title: “What else could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Marivic1211
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8 nights in early October on a 10th anniversary trip to Paris. The boutique hotel lived up to its billing, ranked 4 star according to french plaque on the front of all hotels. It lived up to its ranking, don't let the minimal front exterior fool you. Everything inside was quite nice. The location on the Left Bank is very central to Paris, our mid level inside room was pin drop quiet. Nice appointed with comfy firm bed and pillows, a nice flat screen TV that was suitable for a room this size. Free WiFi if you bring your own laptop, lots of European outlets, don't forget your adapters. My better half loved the towel warmer in the bathrooms and French name branded toiletries. Sleep in with the hyper dark curtains was not an issue. There was a honor bar/fridge with we converted into our own to keep out daily picnic goodies fresh. The location is literally steps from the Louvre and a few blocks from the touristy Latin Quarter. There is a yummy bakery Aux Castelblangeois a block away, this place was our breakfast place for the stay, nothing says love like a warm croissant or baguette, other places around really could not hold a candle to this bakery. The nearby cafes were a touristy rip-off, especially for the cafe-americano, don't be fooled, stick with the expresso. The staff was also quite helpful throughout, with the exception of housekeeping on our last nite, which was non existant??? Perhap she didn't make it in due to the transportation strike that day. The front desk helped us out with a cab to CDG, given the sticky situation with the RER, kudos to them and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: IheartParis2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. I think it was a good hotel for the price. Rooms were small (as expected in Europe) but we had a flat screen TV, modern bathroom, room was very clean. Staff was overall nice and helpful. Location was really great----steps to the Louvre, Rue de Rivoli and to shopping. One downside is the lift is very tiny. With luggage, you can only go up one person at a time. Hallways/stairways also very tiny. Room service was not bad (it was open late), though for the exorbitant price, I would have expected more than the meager portion I was given. Overall, we had a good experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but very clean, stylish and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Fergus316
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for visiting Paris. Only 5 minutes walk to The Louvre and the river. Plenty of places to eat and drink and LOTS of shops! We would recommend La Man'za about 5 minutes walk east along Rue Saint Honore as a friendly and inexpensive place to eat and drink. The hotel itself is very stylish and welcoming. The staff were always helpful and friendly. The room was small but fine for a short break. The bed was a king size with a very firm mattress! The bathroom was good with a great shower and endless hot water. Everything was very clean. The AC was good to as it was unseasonably warm. Breakfast (an optional extra) was good too. The usual continental thing - fruit, cereal, cheese, cold meats, bread and pastries plus scrambled egg, bacon , toast and tea/coffee. Our stay was almost faultless. Our only complaint was the non-existent tea/coffee facilities in the room. We asked for them but they had run out! Surely if you advertise this feature you make sure you have as many trays as you do rooms? (and to the stroppy English woman who was complaining at reception that her bed was too small - weren't the croissants you were stuffing into your bag at breakfast compensation enough???)

Reviews.Title: “unwelcoming and uncaring when there were problems”
Reviews.Author: mazza59Australia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Best Western Louvre St Honore August 1-5. Over many years we have stayed at many of other Best Western properties around the world and therefore have come to expect a certain standard. Certainly the physical facilities were good, but we were severely disappointed with the unwelcoming attitude and poor standard of service in the following areas: • The battery of the safe needed replacement and this was not done until the second day of our stay. • The day the safe battery was fixed, we returned to our room to find the room door had been left open. What an excellent example this was of their attitude to security. • The television was not working in the building for over half of our stay. The problem was not confined to our room but was a system problem. We were given various explanations depending on the staff member on the desk at the time. This included the satellite on the Eiffel Tower not working, something which was clearly not true. Only when I said I would be looking for a partial reimbursement of our accommodation charge was any interest shown in the fact that this property feature was very important to us. We were then offered one free breakfast - only one. The staff member on that occasion also offered discounted access to the hotel movies. When I said a discount was unacceptable, she offered it free of charge – however, since the whole system was not working, this service proved impossible. • The breakfast included tinned fruit salad (not fresh) and powdered rather than fresh milk. Had we not prepaid the accommodation, we would certainly not have remained at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Modern Bathroom and feather pillows ... we liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Kay_And_Cat
Reviews.Content: Can not beat the location. 1/2 block from Odean metro station. 6th Arr very trendy and active. Short walk to Seine, Louvre, Orsay and Blvd Saint Germain & Rue De Rivoli shopping. Staff were friendly and the room rate was great (included breakfast). The room was smallish but okay by French/European standards. Our stay started in August and extended to September 1. Note: the rate almost doubled on Sept 1.

Reviews.Title: “It is 3* very small hotel in the center of Paris with a tiny room like closet”
Reviews.Author: wirpool
Reviews.Content: I used to book it because of affordable price about 110 Euro per night without breakfast. It is about 5 minutes away from the metro in the heart of Paris. The reservation was prepaid on the www.bestwestern.com. It took night manager on duty about 30 minutes to find out that the reservation is really prepaid. I got nervous. Eventually I got the key and took luggage to the fird level by myself (their elevator was out of service). There were in the room EXTREMELY small everything starting from beds and finishing table and deck The room was less 5-6 sq meters and it was the horrible experience I ever had. I would never go to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: bluebrock
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at this hotel, on a room only basis. The room, on the fifth floor was relatively small, though comfortable. The largish double bed was firm and very comfortable, there was a desk and chair, minibar and enough storage for a short stay. There was a wall mounted tv facing the bed. The bathroom was very good, a decent size, and modern with an excellent shower. The reception staff were very helpful, as were the other staff we came in contact with. The lift is possibly the smallest I have ever been in - but, hey, it got us up and down. The best thing for me though was the location - all the following timings are based on gentle stroll speed: Louvre - 2 mins; Pont des Arts over the Seine - 4 mins; Jardin de Tuiellierrie - 6 mins; Place de Concorde and the Champs Elysee - 15 mins; Bus stop for the Hop on hop off bus - 4 mins; Notre Dame - 10 mins. The hotel does offer breakfast (19 euro), but there are many bars/cafes within a few minutes stroll where cheaper breakfasts can be had. I can't comment on the quality of the hotel food, as we did not partake. Room service is available but again we did not use so no comment - you can ask for a complimentary tea/coffe tray though, whch we did use, it contains a kettle and the usual tea/coffee/sugar/ milk. Overall I was more than happy with the quality and location of the hotel compared to the price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful Hotel to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: aussie_jetsetter101
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful - friendly staff, clean but small rooms, however, i think everything must be small over there, lovely food for breakfast, excellent location. Definitely stay there if you are going to Paris. Fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Knowledgeable_One
Reviews.Content: The BEST thing about this hotel is that it’s literally 2minutes walk from the Louvre! The hop on and off open top tour bus stop in located there too which is great and the most convenient way to see the sights if your strapped for time like we were. The staff at reception where helpful and the room we had was clean. Our bathrooms was spacious for EU standards. Don’t forget to take your electricity convert plugs. We forgot ours at home so had to borrow one from the lobby (need to give a 10euro deposit which you get back once the plug is returned). Breakfast wasn’t part of our holiday deal and we were glad we didn’t opt for it as it’s an extra 19euro's per person!!!! Rip off - don’t do it. You’re better off popping into a cafe or bakery to pick up a few croissants to keep you ticking over until Lunch when you can enjoy the atmosphere and people watching culture of Paris. If you want to go to Disneyland Paris from this hotel for the day then make sure you get your tickets BEFORE you entre Paris as they are soooooooo expensive to buy on the day. We got ours on board the Eurostar from London for roughly £48 per person. If we waited to get them from the Hotel lobby or the Disney Park we would have had to pay 170 odd euros!!! The Metro trains are really easy to use so don’t be afraid. The closest Metro station was located about 3 minutes away from the hotel and is called Louvre Rivoli. From here you can get the yellow 1 train to the Chatelet stop where you can get the red A train to take you straight to Disneyland. From Louvre Rivoli you can also the yellow 1 train to the Champs-Elysees (great for food, shopping and Arc de Triomphe and museum vistis. Nothing to do with the hotel but a word of warning for when you go to the Eiffel Tower - people selling key chains and figurines will follow you everywhere and there are at least 10 people selling the same gear!! Very annoying. I wouldn't trust the guys selling water at the tourist places either...they are only for 1euro's compared to the shops/cafe's where you have to pay between 2.50-4.50euros but i would always go for the 2.50-4.50euros bottled water hands down every time - got a feeling they just fill the empty bottles with normal water and then seal the caps with glue....so you have been warned. On a happy note - all in all a good little hotel in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I love Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Katanga
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in great location - virtually next door to the Louvre, on a very busy road! Small rooms, but modern and clean. Staff very helpful. The most disappointing thing about the hotel was the breakfast - truly uninspiring.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable hotel in great location with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: peppap
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from this hotel and were very impressed with everything. It is in a great location for exploring the centre of Paris with plenty of cafes and restaurants round about. Our room was very quiet, beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean with a lovey en suite. The staff on reception were always very pleasant and helpful and all spoke fluent English. We would definately recommend this hotel and would go back again if ever in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: ms_scotsgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not particularly special, and I'm not sure that it deserves the name 'boutique hotel' other than the rather funky lobby bar... and it doesn't have any extra facilities... but for a standard, clean, well kept, small but attractive room without trimmings, in a very convenient location, this hotel is very satisfactory. Disappointing to have a shower but no bath. Nice toiletries. Comfortable bed. Free wifi, though complicated to log on. Breakfast is not included (and is bizarrely expensive). I was happy with this hotel, but at full price would consider it overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: love2travel4242
Reviews.Content: tiny hotel bit hard to spot but great location and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: hlgreene
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was in a fantastic location. You are in the heart of Paris, and many things were in walking distance. If not, the metro station was one block away. We had a room that faced the street and it was a good size. Everything seemed new, updated, and clean. The front desk had only one staff person working at any given time, but they were all friendly and helpful. The lift, which many people have stated, is extremely small, but since it is not a large hotel, we never had a problem with too many people waiting to use it. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Chris2010NewYork
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in this hotel and in Paris. Everything was so perfect! The staff, the room, the breakfast, the location. We stayed 4 nights and it was really too short. We will go back in this hotel for sure! Thanks again for everything. Chris & David.

Reviews.Title: “Would Book it again, Very Good”
Reviews.Author: alanc50
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a very good hotel. Good clean room with ensuite, TV, phone, minibar. It appeared to have been modernised in the recent past. (smallest lift I have ever seen, i wouldnt knock it for that though). Location was great less than 3 minute walk to shops on rue du rivoli or the shopping mall adjoining chatelet des halles metro. also within 5 minutes walk to the louvre. Plenty of nice restaurants nearby too. For us the location was the best. To sum it up, It was clean well maintained reasonably modern and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle...”
Reviews.Author: JasonRossSmith
Reviews.Content: Quiet, comfortable, quaint. Simply loved it. Proximity to the Metro, and Louvre were superb, and I found the price reasonable. Impeccably clean and detailed. Some typical Amercian tourists may dislike the relatively "productive" use of space, and the tiny lift (it is small but cute...) but remember you don't come to Paris to hang out in the room. I would reccomend it to any individual travelers, 2 people traveling as friends or couples. Families with children might feel cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny Rooms, but nice for one night.”
Reviews.Author: mjb25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to attractions, but for more than one night it would be unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Paris never again”
Reviews.Author: Traveller572
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days in this hotel in October, to celebrate my 65th birthday. As everybody else has said: the rooms are very small but on the plus side, they are clean, quiet, the beds are comfortable and the location is great. However, this is not a four-star hotel; facilities are too basic for that, and breakfast ditto. It was not the hotel’s fault that my husband got ill on day 2 but I was not very impressed when, after two doctors visits (cash on the nail) I had to go out in the middle of the night to find a working ATM and get more cash out for the ambulance waiting outside the hotel to take my husband to hospital. I begged reception to lend me the money – which seemed perfectly safe to me; they had our belongings and our credit card details. But it seemed to be against their rules and that was that. I will spare you the details of the French hospital but can tell you that as a foreigner you really don’t count for much. Nobody spoke a word of English, not even the –very rude- doctor and I was not allowed to stay with my husband and translate for him in my (school) French. This is Paris – an international City – full of foreign tourists! Very happy to take your money – not very willing to help when you are ill. We are safely back home now, after a nightmare flight and my husband is on the mend. To quote a famous line from Casablanca “we’ll always have Paris”. Well, perhaps, but we don’t want to go there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dodil
Reviews.Content: Great location of the hotel just 5 minutes from the louvre very close to the subway, line B in Châtelet - Les Halles goes to the Charles de gaulle airport costs €9 and takes about 40 minutes, the subway was VERY crowded when we went. And if you dont wanna pay €17 for your breakfast at the hotel you have lots of options on the street where you can get fresh baguettes and paninis or just sit down in a cafe and have a fresh croissant The hotel is close to everything since its basically in the middle of Paris, walking distance to most Paris attractions, the Eiffel tower is not that close but its a nice walk along the river Seine

Reviews.Title: “A great location, but small”
Reviews.Author: ldwheels
Reviews.Content: You would choose to stay here because of the location. Close to the Louvre, close to subways, close to the river, close to the Left Bank. Likemany city center Paris hotels, be prepared for a very small room, small bath, and small shower. Besides being small, there were also no drawers for stowing clothing but there was a small hanging closet. Also, while the front desk person was willing answer questions, do not expect a concierge level of service. There is only one person on duty to manage all aspects of the hotel from the front desk. They did arrange taxi service for me when asked and retrieved some ice for drinks. They were willing to help when possible. The hotel has been remodeled and decor was fine for this class hotel. We did have an issue with our AC unit leaking condensation water causing the ceiling tile to collapse and wet the carpet. While the issue was fixed the next day (good), there was not an offer to move us to another room (bad). Again, great location, decor nice for this class, would not call it a bad place to stay. If you will not be in your room except to sleep, you can manage here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FinleysDad77
Reviews.Content: I booked a surprise trip for my wife's 30th birthday and had orginally booked a room in the Hotel Des Ducs De Bourgogne but through some kind of error on either my or Expedia's part, (probably mine) I had booked a room for only one person. The receptionist, who I have to say was excellent, informed us that as the hotel was full she would arrange for us to have a room in the Hotel Louvre St Honore for no extra charge. The hotel had recently been refurbished and the reception looked very clean and modern. We were given room 301 by the efficient, although slightly stern, receptionist and after a short trip in the rather small lift, arrived at the narrow third floor corridor which led to our room. The room itself was very clean and tidy and overlooked the Rue St Honore. The bathroom was also very clean and had obviously benefitted from the recent refurbishment; we were also pleased that the room came with a free room safe. We were concerned that the room would be noisy at night but the windows were excellent at blocking out street noise once closed. The location of the hotel was excellent and is definitely its best aspect with the Louvre 5-10 minutes walk away. It is also only a 10 minute walk to Les Halles metro station and excellent for those people arriving at Gare du Nord and jumping on M4 line to get into Paris. Overall our stay was excellent with my only complaint being the air conditioning. Our room was rather warm when we first arrived and no amount of adjusting of the in-room air conditioning seemed to affect this. I spoke to a different receptionist who informed me that the individual room controls don't work and that the air conditioning is operated at a hotel level which takes a few days to adjust after a change in weather and that there was nothing he could do. It is only a small complaint though. We would definitely stay here again but next time may try the Des Ducs De Bourgogne just to see if my initial decision was justified.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rioss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 6 nights just last week. We stayed in Room 201 (a "deluxe room"), with 2 single beds. Overall, the hotel was great! The first moment we stepped into the hotel, we were greeted very warmly by the receptionist, Katherine, who spoke very good English. Checked us in promptly, and got the hotel staff to deliver our bags to our room quickly. The room was small but was really clean, cosy and nice! The elevators and corridors were tiny, but we liked them anyway. We expected 2 double beds actually (according to the website), but had 2 singles instead, and it was placed side by side, with no space in between. We might as well have selected a King size bed for a cheaper price. But we didnt complain much, cos we really loved the coziness of the room. The beds were comfortable, and there was enough space for both of us. Bathroom was pristine! It was clean, modern, and beautiful, and had a nice heater in there. It was also of a nice size too. We were supposed to have a nice view (facing rue st honore, but as the hotel was under renovations, the balcony was covered with plastic sheet. Didnt complain much, as it was because of the recent renovations that we had such a beautiful bathroom and a nice lobby! In any case, we were out for most of the day anyway, so the view was not impt to us. We had some dirt sprayed all over the bed one of the days. It must have come in thru' the gaps in the window from the reno works. The receptionist on duty at night gave us new bedsheets. We has to change it ourselves as there were no chambermaid service at night. So that wasnt very nice. The chambermaid also didnt change it back to a comforter for the rest of the stay. There were no cable tv. There was only 2 English channels (BBC and CNN). Internet was provided by Orange, costing 10 euro for 3 hrs (can be used anytime within 30 days). It is very ex compared to what you can find in US (T mobile). But, that could be the normal rate in Paris. No comment on bfast as we went out for bfast every morning. There is a tabac just downstairs, and they have great coffee and croissants for bfast! The staff there dont speak very much english, but they are very nice, and hv a nice german shepherd in the cafe. There's also an Italian rest next door, which opens on Sun night, which is a relieve, as most restaurants/cafes are closed on Sunday. The hotel is also steps away from the busstop, the Metro (Louvre-Rivoli), from Louvre museum. There also plenty of shops ard the area - restaurants, cafes, pharmacies. There's one convenience store somewhere further up the street. Excellent location! Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Eklasse
Reviews.Content: After looking at all the other TripAdvisor comments we decided to go ahead with our booking at the Louvre Saint Honore – and we’re really glad we did. Yes the elevator is small and as warned by others – renovations are under way so the breakfast area is currently closed – but firstly the hotel’s position firstly is excellent – within minutes of the Louvre and almost everything you want to see in a Paris visit. Our room (601) was excellent and as we’ve stayed in Paris before – exceeded our expectations. Big double windows opening to great views over the street, a very comfortable bed, and a newly, tastefully decorated bathroom, which included a bath! (Unheard of!). I would recommend you request one of the street facing rooms – I don’t know what the others were like – but ours was great. The room was cleaned regularly during our 3 night stay and even at night was quite quiet considering we were right in the city. There are great bars and cafes all around – we enjoyed the Café St Honore down the street, sitting with a great bottle of red and a brilliant Antipasto plate – watching the world go by. The staff there not only speak excellent English – they enjoy their customers – and this was apparent. We had the same great experience with the reception staff of the hotel and have already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lizLincoln
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for four days. A fantastic hotel. Clean, nice rooms, small hotel but right in the centre of Paris within walking distance of the Louvre. Had a beautiful four days.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was great”
Reviews.Author: MSSeattle
Reviews.Content: First, my wife and I stay in many hotels in the US and Europe and always look for a good value for accomodations as we want something comfortable but never live in the room and Paris was no different as there is too much to do. The Louvre Saint Honore is a great hotel in the middle of Paris. As many reviews have stated, the elevator is small so we used the stairs which added to the exercise of walking around Paris. We had room 203 for 7 nights and all was awesome. Clean, comfortable and quiet! The recently remodeled room was typical Parisian, small by american standards, with a shower in a nice bathroom. From our arrival to booking of our airport shuttle, the staff was very accomodating to all of our needs.The room was impecably cleaned every day. Thank you staff! We would definitely stay again. There are many restaurants, shops and attractions within a 2 to 30 minute walk of the hotel. We stopped at many for appetizers or drinks and found most to be friendly with good food. Overall the Louvre Saint Honore is a great place and we suggest you seriously consider it for your next stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean location.”
Reviews.Author: MRANDMRSSMITH05
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for our wedding anniversary at the end of October this year! Hotel was... Clean, very freindly, 24 hour entrance/exit, cosy, and I must say our bed was most probarly one of the comfiest beds I`ve ever slept on! Of course there was small imperfections, small lift and a bit of a damp smell in the lobby..but the lobby was STILL clean! it was only the lack of windows and the size that projected any such smell. The Honor bar??..mmm..all we saw was a polished and empty corner display haha..so never got any of that! But the location is Fab!..and I would stay here again if for a short time. Mrs Smith

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: Pixie_Thunder
Reviews.Content: I Took my partner to stay here as a romantic trip to paris, and to be honest it was a great trip, but the hotel wasn't great. The location was perfect, we walked absolutely everywhere not once needing to get the metro or taxi, which from what I have heard about the taxi's was a good thing. From reading other reviews I believe the Hotel has had a refurb now, but it really was in desperate need of one. Our main concern was the shower, only one of us was able to have a short shower in the morning, a cold one at that. When we told the staff about this they told us it would be fixed, however three days went by, each day we mentioned it, and nothing at all was done. Even when we tried to get up extremely early to beat the shower rush hour ...it still did not make any difference. After a hard day walking the sights of Paris, all you want is a nice shower and then to relax in bed with a bit of Parisian TV....well the TV didnt work either, and if it hadnt been for the fact that I had my Ipod with speakers (which the front desk kindly lent me an adaptor for...after some much explaining of what I wanted it for) we would've had deathly silence!! The Breakfast in the morning was fine, but found the staff very rude, as we tried in our best french to tell them what room number we were, but were pretty much laughed at...I thought it was nice that we were making to speak french unlike the rest of the travellers in there... For location the hotel was great, but for staff hospitality, room condition, and cleanliness, the hotel left us wanting a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: paratanman
Reviews.Content: Fully agree with the previous revue but would mention that breakfast finishes at 10 and they mean 10 not five past. The bar next door is good for an early evening G & T and Le Stado nearly opposite is a very typical bistro serving very good, reasonably priced food. The staff at the Stado are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: rosebug
Reviews.Content: an absolute find for a bargain stay in the heart of paris. recently refurbished, pleasant staff , good breakfast, clean, air conditioned and 3 mins from the seine and the louvre!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here Untill Construction Complete”
Reviews.Author: NjTravel07
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place I have stayed in!!! We were told that there was going to be some minor construction and we were not going to be impacted. Well BS!!! The air didnt work the hotel smelled of mold and the othey thing they said was that they would air it out. All well and good but the windows in our room opened out so that anybody could get in. We change after two days. We stayed the two days because we were told they would change our room. They never did and they keep telling us that there was nothing they could do. If this is park of a booking package stay away. Nice location but that was the only positive thing going for this place. I hope that in the furture they get it fixed. Will post photos of the mold soon.

Reviews.Title: “Safety regulations/Air-con”
Reviews.Author: lastEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well situated.. that's the good point. No Air-con No Fire Regulations in room No instructions for use of telephone No Safe No Tea or Coffee facilities in the room No Wi-fi No Modem etc These were all all purchased from hotel information but not available. Staff attitude probabley the worst we have encountered in our travels around the world

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelNI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really brilliant location and is central to all the attractions in Paris - your feet will be sore !!! The hotel is small with a really small lift and a lot of stairs but is very very comfortable with very friendly staff that spoke good English. A wee tip for anyone travelling to the hotel from Gare de Nord (Eurostar) take metro line 4 to station called Chatelet. From there you can either a) connect onto Line 1 of Metro and get off at Palais Royal OR b) walk from Chatelet station to the hotel which is a 5 minute walk down Rue St Honore to hotel. It;s a lovely small hotel and very reasonably priced !!!! Will be back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liamnuttall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is in a great central location with good access to the metro and RER services. The staff were all very friendly and spoke extremely good english. The hotel was nicer than I had expected with the rooms being large and spacious. There were only two downsides to this small typically french hotel. 1. The bedrooms were quite warm and the air conditioning wasn't great. Although the weather was hot during out stay 2. The rooms have a shower head connected to the tap which does work, however there was NO shower curtain!! therefore showering was a little difficult without soaking the bathroom. Other than that I would certainly recommend this hotel as it is well priced, very clean and generally a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel just okay.....”
Reviews.Author: Bobster2006
Reviews.Content: As previous reviews say, the hotel is in a great location, so I will not witter on again about that suffice to say that they're spot-on. The hotel itself is not great. We we're lucky and had the only room in the hotel with a balcony (room 201). Others in our party who had reserved the same superior rooms got much smaller rooms at the back of the hotel. Seems that the majority of the rooms are serviced by 1 small corridor/stairwall and we did not see any fire escape route except out the window, and down the drainpipe. In general, the rooms could do with a lick of paint and some modernisation. They are habitiable though. You may find a wardrobe door hanging off or a socket not working but they're (just) okay as a base to explore. Breakfast was again, just okay, but be prepared to get the evil eye if you are still there 1 minute after 10am. Or arrive at 9.50am. Staff weren't that great either - "Can I have a knife" - "No you can't" (it was close to breakfast closing). No corkscrew in the hotel - it was suggested I purchase one down the road. Not to mention the non-existant honesty bar (the one with the non-existant corkscrew). But hey, the whole experience wasn’t too bad and it certainly didn’t wreck the weekend. Just set your expectations slightly lower than the hotel website. If you are arriving at Charles de Gaulle airport, you can get an RER train direct to Chatlet les Halles and then it’s a five minute walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jazzymanchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the 30/12/06 for 3 nts, the hotel was very small and the first room we were put in was tiny and over looking a big generator (ROOM 111) We went to reception and they changed us very reluctantly to room 102 on the bottom floor, This room was more spacious but the room leaked every night with water through the ceiling dripping all night, When we informed the hotel staff they said the hotel was FULL and if we were not happy to change hotels, The tv was not working at all and the towel rail was broken, the internet sites were not working, if you are staying on the ground floor the door adjacent to your room bangs all day and night as it is the only entrance to all the other rooms, The lifts are 30cms in width tiny, The hotel staff were very unhelpful and couldnt be bothered with even a good morning, we enquired about places to go on new years eve and we were told to go out and ask at restaurants, not very helpful......... On our last day we went to the louvre musee at 8.00 am to beat the queues and it was closed, we were told it only closes on chrismas day and new years day but it was closed on the 2/1/07 The breakfast was not a FULL breakfast as the confirmation states it is cereal or bread and a bowl of hot scrambled egg, no toast, very dissappointing, When we complained we had to wait for the manager to come to the hotel , we waited all morning and only spoke to him 5 minutes before we left for the airport, he was apologetic and stated the room was appauling but he wasnt there to do anything, overall stay at home for new year...........

Reviews.Title: “great location and room, very poor service.”
Reviews.Author: traveller85
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at Hotel Louvre Saint Honore because it was in a great central location and the superior rooms seemed comfortable and stylish. We were not disappointed, as the location is perfect for visiting all the sights and the room was spacious and clean with pleasant decor. The problems we had were more with the service than the accomodation. When we arrived in the room, the TV did not work. I went downstairs to inform the receptionist that it wasn't working in our room. He told me that he knew this and none of the TVs in the hotel were working. He said they had rung and faxed their maintainancce company who hadn't responded and they didn't know when they would be fixed. When asked how long they had been broken a few days. Later that day my mum and I spoke to a couple who were staying until New Year and they believed that this had been the case for the past two weeks. This is not such a big deal, as we didn't come to Paris to watch TV, but it was very quiet at night and it is nice to watch french TV to see what is happening in the rest of the country and in Paris. In addition to this problem, the staff were really unfriendly and it was hard work to even get a greeting out of them, in either english or french. The breakfast was fine, but really just the minimum. The breakfast staff even complained rudely to guests arriving for breakfast at 9.40am, even though breakfast was served until 10am. All of the hotel staff gave the impression that they didn't want the guests to be there and everything was just too much effort for them before christmas. Accomodation-wise, the hotel is very well located, comfortable and cosy. Unfortunately these problems cast a shadow over the experience as a whole and we would not be able to recommend this hotel. We have stayed in Paris many times and know what to expect from capital city hotels. For the price of the rooms, you can do a lot better!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wetfarm
Reviews.Content: I would recommend anyone stays in this hotel based on my experience. Okay some people have reviewed that it is small...yes it is...but then again for the price you really wont get much bigger in the same location in Paris. We got a room on the very top floor at the front of the hotel, it had a lovely view and when you opened the window a lovely Paris breeze blew through the room. The room was not very noisy despite being at the front of the hotel. The location of the hotel really has to be its best point and should influence everyones decision as it really is superb. The Louvre is a 5 minute walk round the corner, the Opera a 10 minute walk straight up the road, the nearest Metro is a 3 minute walk, from which you are only 2 changes from Eiffel Tower. Slightly further away, walking again, you have Notre Dame - 15-20mins, Pompido Centre 10mins. This hoel really is a great base for any Parisien holiday, the staff are very helpful & friendly and will help with anything you ask and they speak good English. The breakfasts are alright though I have had better, though it is a buffet and the croissants are very nice, perfect start to a busy day in Paris. We went for 4 nights and ran out of time!! If anyone wants anymore info on this hotel or in fact Paris then please do not hesitate in contacting me.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier Louvre Saint Honore
HotelInfo.Address: 141 rue Saint Honore, 75001 Paris, France
